Sentencas: Ceria-rare earth solid solutions are known as solid electrolytes with potential applications in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: Trivalent rare earth ions enter into solid solution introducing anion vacancies for charge compensation.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: These oxygen vacancies are quite mobile at moderate temperatures giving rise to a comparatively high ionic conduction.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: In this study, rare-earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 (x = 0.0-0.20) fine powders were prepared by a sol-gel method.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The XRD results showed that all powders crystallite calcined at 800 degrees C were single phase with cubic fluorite structure; the average crystallite size was between 24 and 35 nm, which was in good agreement with the results of TEM and particle size distribution measurements.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The SEM results exhibited that electrolyte pellets sintered at 1400 degrees C were dense, and the relative densities of these pellets were over 99%.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: Impedance spectra analysis of these electrolytes has been performed at 250-850 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC
Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: and Ce0.8Sm0.1Y0.1O1.9 appeared higher conductivity and lower activation energy than the singly doped ceria with the same dopant concentration (20% trivalent rare earth) at the temperature range of 550-700 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: The maximum power density and the maximum current density for the single SOFC based on the two samples were higher than singly doped sample with the same vacancy concentration.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC

Sentencas: Therefore, it is concluded that co-doping with an appropriate ratio of samarium and yttrium can further improve the electrical performance of ceria-based electrolytes.
Titulo: Preparation and properties of rare earth co-doped Ce0.8Sm0.2-xYxO1.9 electrolyte materials for SOFC
